API Reference¶

The following section outlines the Subclasses contained in the Utils library and their respective methods.

class src.bot.BotU(command_prefix, *, help_command=<default-help-command>, tree_cls=<class 'discord.app_commands.tree.CommandTree'>, description=None, allowed_contexts=..., allowed_installs=..., intents, **options)¶

Bases: discord.ext.commands.bot.AutoShardedBot

This is similar to Bot except that it is inherited from discord.AutoShardedClient instead.

async with x

Asynchronously initialises the bot and automatically cleans.

New in version 2.0.

property avatar_url¶

Get’s the bot’s avatar URL. If the bot has no avatar, raises AttributeError.

Raises

AttributeError – If the bot has no avatar.

Returns

The bot’s avatar URL.

Return type

str

property owner¶

Renamed because is_owner doesn’t work with the new application_info.

Returns

The bot’s owner.

Return type

discord.User

await get_context(origin, *, cls=<class 'src.context.ContextU'>)¶

This function is a coroutine.

Returns the invocation context from the message or interaction.

This is a more low-level counter-part for process_commands() to allow users more fine grained control over the processing.

The returned context is not guaranteed to be a valid invocation context, Context.valid must be checked to make sure it is. If the context is not valid then it is not a valid candidate to be invoked under invoke().

Note

In order for the custom context to be used inside an interaction-based context (such as HybridCommand) then this method must be overridden to return that class.

Changed in version 2.0: message parameter is now positional-only and renamed to origin.

Parameters

  • origin (Union[discord.Message, discord.Interaction]) – The message or interaction to get the invocation context from.

  • cls – The factory class that will be used to create the context. By default, this is Context. Should a custom class be provided, it must be similar enough to Context's interface.

Returns

The invocation context. The type of this can change via the cls parameter.

Return type

Context

await get_or_fetch_channel(channelid, guild=None)¶

Gets a channel from a guild (if provided) or bot’s cache, else fetches it. Will error if fetch fails.

Parameters

  • channelid (int) – The ID of the channel to get.

  • guild (Optional[discord.Guild]) – The guild to get the channel from.

Raises

discord.InvalidData – If the channel is not found or is not the correct type.

Returns

The channel.

Return type

Union[discord.abc.GuildChannel, discord.Thread, discord.PrivateChannel]

await get_or_fetch_thread(threadid, guild)¶

Gets or fetches a Thread (Forum or TextChannel thread) from the provided guild. If None or a non-Thread is returned, raises AssertionError.

Parameters

  • threadid (int) – The ID of the thread to get.

  • guild (discord.Guild) – The guild to get the thread from.

Raises

discord.InvalidData – If the thread is not found or is not the correct type.

Returns

The thread.

Return type

discord.Thread

await get_or_fetch_user(userid, guild)¶

Gets a discord.User or discord.Member from a guild (if provided) or bot’s cache, else fetches it. Will error if fetch fails.

Parameters

  • userid (int) – The ID of the user to get.

  • guild (Optional[discord.Guild]) – The guild to get the user from.

Raises

discord.InvalidData – If the user is not found.

Returns

  • Union[discord.User, discord.Member] – The user.

  • .. note:: – If the user is in a guild, it will return a Member. You must pass explicitly pass None for the guild if you wish to get a user not in a guild.

await get_or_fetch_member(userid, guild)¶

Gets a Member from the guild’s cache, else fetches it. Will error if fetch fails. Raises a discord.NotFound or discord.Forbidden if fetch fails.

Parameters

  • userid (int) – The ID of the user.

  • guild (discord.Guild) – The Guild object to get the member from.

Returns

The Member object.

Return type

discord.Member

Raises

  • discord.NotFound – If the member cannot be found.

  • discord.Forbidden – If the bot does not have permission to fetch the member.

Parameters

guildid (int) – The ID of the guild.

Returns

The Guild object.

Return type

discord.Guild

Raises

  • discord.HTTPException – If the guild cannot be fetched.

  • discord.Forbidden – If the bot does not have permission to fetch the guild.

await get_command_mention(command)¶

Gets the Mention string for a command. If the tree is a MentionableTree, it will return the mention string for the command. If the command ID cannot be found, it will return a string with the command name in backticks.

Parameters

command (Union[str, discord.ext.commands.Command]) – The command/name of the command to get the mention for.

Returns

The mention string for the command.

Return type

str

Context Subclasses¶

ContextU¶

Attributes
  • max_file_limit
Methods

class src.context.ContextU(*, message, bot, view, args=..., kwargs=..., prefix=None, command=None, invoked_with=None, invoked_parents=..., invoked_subcommand=None, subcommand_passed=None, command_failed=False, current_parameter=None, current_argument=None, interaction=None)¶

Bases: discord.ext.commands.context.Context

Context Subclass to add some extra functionality.

await defer(*args, **kwargs)¶

This function is a coroutine.

Defers the interaction based contexts.

This is typically used when the interaction is acknowledged and a secondary action will be done later.

If this isn’t an interaction based context then it does nothing.

Parameters

ephemeral (bool) – Indicates whether the deferred message will eventually be ephemeral.

Raises

  • HTTPException – Deferring the interaction failed.

  • InteractionResponded – This interaction has already been responded to before.

await send(*args, **kwargs)¶

This function is a coroutine.

Sends a message to the destination with the content given.

This works similarly to send() for non-interaction contexts.

For interaction based contexts this does one of the following:

  • discord.InteractionResponse.send_message() if no response has been given.

  • A followup message if a response has been given.

  • Regular send if the interaction has expired

Changed in version 2.0: This function will now raise TypeError or ValueError instead of InvalidArgument.

Parameters

  • content (Optional[str]) – The content of the message to send.

  • tts (bool) – Indicates if the message should be sent using text-to-speech.

  • embed (Embed) – The rich embed for the content.

  • file (File) – The file to upload.

  • files (List[File]) – A list of files to upload. Must be a maximum of 10.

  • nonce (int) – The nonce to use for sending this message. If the message was successfully sent, then the message will have a nonce with this value.

  • delete_after (float) – If provided, the number of seconds to wait in the background before deleting the message we just sent. If the deletion fails, then it is silently ignored.

  • allowed_mentions (AllowedMentions) –

    Controls the mentions being processed in this message. If this is passed, then the object is merged with allowed_mentions. The merging behaviour only overrides attributes that have been explicitly passed to the object, otherwise it uses the attributes set in allowed_mentions. If no object is passed at all then the defaults given by allowed_mentions are used instead.

    New in version 1.4.

  • reference (Union[Message, MessageReference, PartialMessage]) –

    A reference to the Message to which you are replying, this can be created using to_reference() or passed directly as a Message. You can control whether this mentions the author of the referenced message using the replied_user attribute of allowed_mentions or by setting mention_author.

    This is ignored for interaction based contexts.

    New in version 1.6.

  • mention_author (Optional[bool]) –

    If set, overrides the replied_user attribute of allowed_mentions. This is ignored for interaction based contexts.

    New in version 1.6.

  • view (discord.ui.View) –

    A Discord UI View to add to the message.

    New in version 2.0.

  • embeds (List[Embed]) –

    A list of embeds to upload. Must be a maximum of 10.

    New in version 2.0.

  • stickers (Sequence[Union[GuildSticker, StickerItem]]) –

    A list of stickers to upload. Must be a maximum of 3. This is ignored for interaction based contexts.

    New in version 2.0.

  • suppress_embeds (bool) –

    Whether to suppress embeds for the message. This sends the message without any embeds if set to True.

    New in version 2.0.

  • ephemeral (bool) –

    Indicates if the message should only be visible to the user who started the interaction. If a view is sent with an ephemeral message and it has no timeout set then the timeout is set to 15 minutes. This is only applicable in contexts with an interaction.

    New in version 2.0.

  • silent (bool) –

    Whether to suppress push and desktop notifications for the message. This will increment the mention counter in the UI, but will not actually send a notification.

    New in version 2.2.

  • poll (Poll) –

    The poll to send with this message.

    New in version 2.4.

Raises

  • HTTPException – Sending the message failed.

  • Forbidden – You do not have the proper permissions to send the message.

  • ValueError – The files list is not of the appropriate size.

  • TypeError – You specified both file and files, or you specified both embed and embeds, or the reference object is not a Message, MessageReference or PartialMessage.

Returns

The message that was sent.

Return type

Message

await reply(*args, **kwargs)¶

This function is a coroutine.

A shortcut method to send() to reply to the Message referenced by this context.

For interaction based contexts, this is the same as send().

New in version 1.6.

Changed in version 2.0: This function will now raise TypeError or ValueError instead of InvalidArgument.

Raises

  • HTTPException – Sending the message failed.

  • Forbidden – You do not have the proper permissions to send the message.

  • ValueError – The files list is not of the appropriate size

  • TypeError – You specified both file and files.

Returns

The message that was sent.

Return type

Message

await prompt(message=None, embed=None, *, timeout=60.0, delete_after=True, author_id=None)¶

An interactive reaction confirmation dialog.

Note

You must pass either a message or embed in order for this function to work.

Parameters

  • message (Optional[str]) – The message to show along with the prompt, defaults to None.

  • embed (Optional[discord.Embed]) – The embed to show along with the prompt, defaults to None.

  • timeout (Optional[float]) – How long to wait before returning, defaults to 60.0.

  • delete_after (bool) – Whether to delete the confirmation message after we’re done, defaults to True.

  • author_id (Optional[int]) – The member who should respond to the prompt. Defaults to the author of the Context’s message.

Returns

True if explicit confirm, False if explicit deny, None if deny due to timeout.

Return type

Optional[bool]

property max_file_limit¶

The maximum file size that can be uploaded to Discord in bytes (in the context of the current guild, if there is one).

This method is a wrapper/calls the src.methods.get_max_file_limit() method.

Returns

The maximum file size that can be uploaded to Discord in this context (in bytes).

Return type

int

await safe_send(content, *, escape_mentions=True, **kwargs)¶

Same as send except with some safe guards.

  1. If the message is too long then it sends a file with the results instead.

  2. If escape_mentions is True then it escapes mentions.

Note

The following subclasses are used to represent the context of a command/event in a specific environment (e.g. Guild, DM). No code changes are made, only changes related to typing.

GuildContextU¶

class src.context.GuildContextU(*, message, bot, view, args=..., kwargs=..., prefix=None, command=None, invoked_with=None, invoked_parents=..., invoked_subcommand=None, subcommand_passed=None, command_failed=False, current_parameter=None, current_argument=None, interaction=None)¶

Bases: src.context.ContextU

Guild Context Subclass to add some extra functionality. Only types are changed to support Guilds.

class src.cog.CogU(*args, **kwargs)¶

A subclass of Cog that includes a hidden attribute. Intended for use in Help commands where entire cogs shouldn’t be shown by default.

Show-inheritance

await _get(*args, **kwargs)¶

This function is a coroutine. Performs a GET request on the given URL. This method is a wrapper for aiohttp.ClientSession.get().

await _post(*args, **kwargs)¶

This function is a coroutine. Performs a POST request on the given URL. This method is a wrapper for aiohttp.ClientSession.post().

await _patch(*args, **kwargs)¶

This function is a coroutine. Performs a PATCH request on the given URL. This method is a wrapper for aiohttp.ClientSession.patch().

await _put(*args, **kwargs)¶

“This function is a coroutine. Performs a PUT request on the given URL. This method is a wrapper for aiohttp.ClientSession.put().

await _delete(*args, **kwargs)¶

This function is a coroutine. Performs a DELETE request on the given URL. This method is a wrapper for aiohttp.ClientSession.delete().

await get_command_mention(command)¶

This function is a coroutine. Gets the Mention string for a command. If the tree is a MentionableTree, it will return the mention string for the command. If the command ID cannot be found, it will return a string with the command name in backticks.

Note

This method is just a shortcut/legacy method that calls get_command_mention().

Parameters

command (Union[str, discord.ext.commands.Command]) – The callback to be used for the parameter. This should take only two parameters, ctx and value.

Returns

The command mention string.

Return type

str

class src.command.CommandU(*args, **kwargs)¶

Bases: discord.ext.commands.core.Command, Generic[discord.ext.commands._types.CogT, src.command.P, src.command.T]

Implements the front end CommandU functionality. This subclasses discord.ext.commands.Command to add some fun utility functions.

autocompletes¶

A mapping of parameter name to autocomplete objects. This is so autocomplete can be added to the command.

Type

Dict[str, AutoComplete]

property help_mapping¶

Parses the CommandU’s help text into a mapping that can be used to generate a help embed or give the user more inforamtion about the command.

Return type

Mapping[str, str]

property help_embed¶

Creates a help embed for the command.

Type

discord.Embed

add_autocomplete(*, callback, param)¶

Adds an autocomplete callback to the command for a given parameter.

Parameters

  • callback (typing.Callable) – The callback to be used for the parameter. This should take only two parameters, ctx and value.

  • param (str) – The name of the parameter to add the autocomplete to.

Returns

The autocomplete object that was created.

Return type

AutoComplete

Raises

ValueError – The parameter is already assigned an autocomplete, or the parameter is not in the list of parameters registered to the command.

autocomplete(param)¶

A decorator to register a callback as an autocomplete for a parameter.

@commands.command()
async def foo(self, ctx: ContextU, argument: str) -> None:
    return await ctx.send(f'You selected {argument!}')

@foo.autocomplete('argument')
async def foo_autocomplete(ctx: ContextU, value: str) -> Iterable[str]:
    data: Tuple[str, ...] = await self.bot.get_some_data(ctx.guild.id)
    return data
Parameters

param (str) – The name of the parameter to add the autocomplete to.

GroupU¶

Attributes
  • case_insensitive
  • invoke_without_command
Methods
  • defcommand
  • defgroup
class src.command.GroupU(*args, **attrs)¶

Bases: discord.ext.commands.core.GroupMixin[discord.ext.commands._types.CogT], src.command.CommandU[discord.ext.commands._types.CogT, src.command.P, src.command.T]

A class that implements a grouping protocol for commands to be executed as subcommands.

This class is a subclass of Command and thus all options valid in Command are valid in here as well.

invoke_without_command¶

Indicates if the group callback should begin parsing and invocation only if no subcommand was found. Useful for making it an error handling function to tell the user that no subcommand was found or to have different functionality in case no subcommand was found. If this is False, then the group callback will always be invoked first. This means that the checks and the parsing dictated by its parameters will be executed. Defaults to False.

Type

bool

case_insensitive¶

Indicates if the group’s commands should be case insensitive. Defaults to False.

Type

bool

command(*args, **kwargs)¶

Register a function as a CommandU.

Parameters

  • name (Optional[str]) – The name of the command, or None to use the function’s name.

  • description (Optional[str]) – The description of the command, or None to use the function’s docstring.

  • brief (Optional[str]) – The brief description of the command, or None to use the first line of the function’s docstring.

  • aliases (Optional[Iterable[str]]) – The aliases of the command, or None to use the function’s name.

  • **attrs (Any) – The keyword arguments to pass to the CommandU.

group(*args, **kwargs)¶

Register a function as a GroupU.

Parameters

  • name (Optional[str]) – The name of the command, or None to use the function’s name.

  • description (Optional[str]) – The description of the command, or None to use the function’s docstring.

  • brief (Optional[str]) – The brief description of the command, or None to use the first line of the function’s docstring.

  • aliases (Optional[Iterable[str]]) – The aliases of the command, or None to use the function’s name.

  • **attrs (Any) – The keyword arguments to pass to the GroupU.

HybridCommandU¶

Methods
  • defautocomplete
class src.command.HybridCommandU(func, /, *, name=..., description=..., **kwargs)¶

Bases: discord.ext.commands.hybrid.HybridCommand, src.command.CommandU

A class that is both an application command and a regular text command.

This has the same parameters and attributes as a regular Command. However, it also doubles as an application command. In order for this to work, the callbacks must have the same subset that is supported by application commands.

These are not created manually, instead they are created via the decorator or functional interface.

New in version 2.0.

autocomplete(name, slash=True, message=False)¶

A decorator that registers a coroutine as an autocomplete prompt for a parameter.

This is the same as autocomplete(). It is only applicable for the application command and doesn’t do anything if the command is a regular command.

Note

Similar to the autocomplete() method, this takes Interaction as a parameter rather than a Context.

Parameters

name (str) – The parameter name to register as autocomplete.

Raises

TypeError – The coroutine passed is not actually a coroutine or the parameter is not found or of an invalid type.

HybridGroupU¶

Attributes
  • fallback
  • fallback_locale
Methods
  • defautocomplete
class src.command.HybridGroupU(*args, name=..., description=..., fallback=None, **attrs)¶

Bases: discord.ext.commands.hybrid.HybridGroup, src.command.GroupU

A class that is both an application command group and a regular text group.

This has the same parameters and attributes as a regular Group. However, it also doubles as an application command group. Note that application commands groups cannot have callbacks associated with them, so the callback is only called if it’s not invoked as an application command.

Hybrid groups will always have Group.invoke_without_command set to True.

These are not created manually, instead they are created via the decorator or functional interface.

New in version 2.0.

fallback¶

The command name to use as a fallback for the application command. Since application command groups cannot be invoked, this creates a subcommand within the group that can be invoked with the given group callback. If None then no fallback command is given. Defaults to None.

Type

Optional[str]

fallback_locale¶

The fallback command name’s locale string, if available.

Type

Optional[locale_str]

autocomplete(name, slash=True, message=False)¶

A decorator that registers a coroutine as an autocomplete prompt for a parameter.

This is the same as autocomplete(). It is only applicable for the application command and doesn’t do anything if the command is a regular command.

This is only available if the group has a fallback application command registered.

Note

Similar to the autocomplete() method, this takes Interaction as a parameter rather than a Context.

Parameters

name (str) – The parameter name to register as autocomplete.

Raises

TypeError – The coroutine passed is not actually a coroutine or the parameter is not found or of an invalid type.

Converter Subclasses¶

Bases: discord.ext.commands.converter.Converter

EmojiConverter¶

class src.converters.EmojiConverter(*args, **kwargs)¶

Bases: discord.ext.commands.converter.EmojiConverter

Converts to a discord.Emoji or discord.PartialEmoji object. This converter is more lenient than the default discord.ext.commands.EmojiConverter, verifying a discord.PartialEmoji is usable by the bot and also correctly converts Unicode emoji.

Custom Enums¶

RequestType¶

This isn’t perfect, but has the types of Request used in this library.

class src.enums.RequestType¶

Specifies the type of web request.

GET¶

Represents a GET request.

POST¶

Represents a POST request.

PUT¶

Represents a PUT request.

PATCH¶

Represents a PATCH request.

DELETE¶

Represents a DELETE request.

RequestType.get_method_callable(session)¶

Returns the method callable for the request type. Returns the callable is for the provided session object (ex: session.get for a GET instance of the enum).

Parameters

session (aiohttp.ClientSession The session object to get the method callable for.) –

Return type

Callable The method callable for the request type.

IntegrationType¶

class src.enums.IntegrationType¶

Specifies the type of integration.

This class has the __int__ method defined to convert the IntegrationType to an integer.

guild¶

Represents a Guild integration type. Represented by a 0.

user¶

Represents a User integration. Represented by a 1.

Paginators¶

Special thanks to the following original code author for the Paginator classes:n -> @soheab on Discord (150665783268212746)

All additional modifications and improvements are made by the author of this library, Ken-Miles.

Classes¶

BaseButtonPaginator¶

class src.paginator.BaseButtonPaginator(pages, *, author_id=None, timeout=180.0, delete_message_after=False, per_page=1, go_to_button=False)¶

Made by @soheab on Discord, taken from the Discord.py Discord Server

stop()¶

Stops listening to interaction events from this view.

This operation cannot be undone.

await interaction_check(interaction)¶

This function is a coroutine.

A callback that is called when an interaction happens within the view that checks whether the view should process item callbacks for the interaction.

This is useful to override if, for example, you want to ensure that the interaction author is a given user.

The default implementation of this returns True.

Note

If an exception occurs within the body then the check is considered a failure and on_error() is called.

Parameters

interaction (Interaction) – The interaction that occurred.

Returns

Whether the view children’s callbacks should be called.

Return type

bool

await on_timeout()¶

This function is a coroutine.

A callback that is called when a view’s timeout elapses without being explicitly stopped.

ButtonPaginator¶

class src.paginator.ButtonPaginator(*args, **kwargs)¶

Note

This class also has an alias of src.paginator.ThreeButtonPaginator for ease of use.

FiveButtonPaginator¶

class src.paginator.FiveButtonPaginator(*args, **kwargs)¶

Bases: src.paginator.BaseButtonPaginator

Note

This subclass doesn’t add any additional attributes or methods, but instead overrides the internal methods of the BaseButtonPaginator class. It also adds the additional buttons if applicable.

Methods¶

generate_pages¶

paginator.generate_pages(items_per_page=None, add_page_nums=True, **kwargs)¶

Generate pages for an Embed Paginator.

Parameters

  • items (List[str]) – A list of items to paginate.

  • items_per_page (Optional[int]) – The number of lines/items to show per page. Defaults to when the page is at 2000 characters.

  • add_page_nums (bool) – Whether to add page numbers to the footer. Defaults to True.

  • kwargs (Any) – Additional keyword arguments to pass to the Embed.

Returns

A list of Embeds generated from the items.

Return type

List[discord.Embed]

create_paginator¶

await paginator.create_paginator(pages, paginator=<class 'src.paginator.BaseButtonPaginator'>, author_id=None, timeout=180.0, go_to_button=False, delete_message_after=False, per_page=1)¶

Shortcut method to create a paginator object and start it.

Note

This method starts the paginator immediately. This method will not return until the paginator times out.

Parameters

  • ctx (ContextU) – The context object.

  • Sequence[Any] (pages) – The pages to paginate. Should be a List of :class:`discord.Embed`s or :class:`str`s.

  • paginator (Type[src.paginators.BaseButtonPaginator]) – The paginator to use. Defaults to src.paginators.BaseButtonPaginator.

  • author_id (Optional[int]) – The ID of the author that requested this paginator. If provided, use of the paginator will be restricted to this user. Defaults to None.

  • timeout (Optional[float]) – The timeout of the view related to the embed. Defaults to 180.0.

  • go_to_button (bool) – Whether a “Go To” button should be included in the paginator. Defaults to False.

  • delete_message_after (bool) – Whether the message/paginator should be deleted on timeout/stop. Defaults to False.

  • per_page (int) – How many embeds should be shown per page. You most likely want this at 1. Defaults to 1.

Returns

The paginator object.

Return type

BaseButtonPaginator

Other Utilities¶

Embed-related methods¶

methods.makeembed(timestamp=..., color=None, description=..., author=None, author_url=None, author_icon_url=None, footer=None, footer_icon_url=None, url=..., image=None, thumbnail=None)¶

Creates an embed.

Parameters

  • title (Optional[Union[str, discord.app_commands.locale_str]]) – The title of the embed.

  • timestamp (Optional[datetime.datetime]) – The timestamp of the embed.

  • color (Optional[discord.Colour]) – The color of the embed.

  • description (Optional[Union[str, discord.app_commands.locale_str]]) – The description of the embed.

  • author (Optional[Union[str, discord.app_commands.locale_str]]) – The author of the embed. Sets the name of the author.

  • author_url (Optional[Union[str, discord.app_commands.locale_str]]) – The author URL of the embed. Sets the URL of the author.

  • author_icon_url (Optional[Union[str, discord.app_commands.locale_str]]) – The author icon URL of the embed. Sets the icon URL of the author.

  • footer (Optional[Union[str, discord.app_commands.locale_str]]) – The footer of the embed. Sets the text of the footer.

  • footer_icon_url (Optional[Union[str, discord.app_commands.locale_str]]) – The footer icon URL of the embed. Sets the icon URL of the footer.

  • url (Optional[Union[str, discord.app_commands.locale_str]]) – The URL of the embed. Sets the URL of the embed.

  • image (Optional[Union[str, discord.app_commands.locale_str]]) – The image of the embed. Sets the image URL of the embed.

  • thumbnail (Optional[Union[str, discord.app_commands.locale_str]]) – The thumbnail of the embed. Sets the thumbnail URL of the embed.

Returns

The created embed.

Return type

discord.Embed

methods.makeembed_bot(timestamp=..., color=None, description=..., author=None, author_url=None, author_icon_url=None, footer=None, footer_icon_url=None, url=..., image=None, thumbnail=None, *, bot=None, app_info=None, bot_owner=None, command_user=None)¶

Creates an embed for the bot. Changed defaults for makeembed: color, footer, timestamp.

bot, app_info, bot_owner can be provided to provide an footer text and icon.

if command_user is provided, a “requested by {user}” and author icon will be added.

This method provides default values for parameters of makeembed().

methods.makeembed_failedaction(*, title=..., timestamp=..., color=<Colour value=15548997>, author=None, author_url=None, author_icon_url=None, footer=None, footer_icon_url=None, url=..., image=None, thumbnail=None, **kwargs)¶

Creates an embed for a failed action. Changed defaults for makeembed_bot: color, footer. This method calls makeembed_bot() with the changed defaults.

methods.makeembed_successfulaction(*, title=..., timestamp=..., color=<Colour value=5763719>, author=None, author_url=None, author_icon_url=None, footer=None, footer_icon_url=None, url=..., image=None, thumbnail=None, **kwargs)¶

Changed defaults for makeembed_bot: color. This method calls makeembed_bot() with the changed defaults.

methods.makeembed_partialaction(*, title=..., timestamp=..., color=<Colour value=15844367>, author=None, author_url=None, author_icon_url=None, footer=None, footer_icon_url=None, url=..., image=None, thumbnail=None, **kwargs)¶

Creates an embed for a partially successful action. Changed defaults for makeembed_bot: color. This method calls makeembed_bot() with the changed defaults.

Formatting methods¶

dctimestamp¶

methods.dctimestamp(format='f')¶

Formats a timestamp for Discord. This method functions similar to discord.utils.format_dt(), except it can also accepts a int or float as the timestamp.

Discord Timestamps allows for a locale-independent way of presenting data using Discord specific Markdown.

Style

Example Output

Description

t

22:57

Short Time

T

22:57:58

Long Time

d

17/05/2016

Short Date

D

17 May 2016

Long Date

f (default)

17 May 2016 22:57

Short Date Time

F

Tuesday, 17 May 2016 22:57

Long Date Time

R

5 years ago

Relative Time

For more information, you can view the Discord Documentation on https://discord.com/developers/docs/reference#message-formatting.

Parameters

  • dt (Union[datetime.datetime, int, float]) – The timestamp to format.

  • format (timestamptype) – The format to use. Defaults to "f".

Returns

The formatted timestamp.

Return type

str

dchyperlink¶

methods.dchyperlink(texttoclick, *, hovertext=None, suppress_embed=False)¶

Creates a hyperlink for Discord. This method creates a hyperlink for Discord, with the option to suppress the embed.

The return string will be in the following format which will create a hyperlink in Discord: [texttoclick](url “hovertext”)

Note

If the texttoclick parameter is a URL, the url and texttoclick parameters will be switched.

Parameters

  • url (Union[str, discord.app_commands.locale_str]) – The URL to hyperlink to.

  • texttoclick (Union[str, discord.app_commands.locale_str]) – The text to show up as the hyperlink.

  • hovertext (Optional[Union[str, discord.app_commands.locale_str]]) – The text to display when the link is hovered over. Defaults to None.

  • suppress_embed (bool) – Whether to suppress the embed created by the link. Defaults to False.

Returns

The hyperlink string.

Return type

str

create_codeblock¶

await methods.create_codeblock(lang='py')¶

Creates a codeblock formatted for Discord.

Parameters

  • content (Union[str, discord.app_commands.locale_str]) – The content of the codeblock.

  • lang (CodeblockLanguage, optional) – The language code of the codeblock. Defaults to py.

Returns

The formatted codeblock.

Return type

str

Raises

ValueError – If the language is not a valid language code.

Autocomplete methods¶

generic_autocomplete¶

await methods.generic_autocomplete(items, interaction=None, cutoff=0.4)¶

Autocompletes a command choice.

Parameters

  • current (Union[str, discord.app_commands.locale_str]) – The current input.

  • items (Union[Sequence[Any], Sequence[Tuple[Any, Any]]]) – The items to autocomplete. Can either be a list of items or a list of tuples with the first element being the name of the item and the second element being the value of the item.

  • interaction (Optional[discord.Interaction]) – The interaction related to this autocomplete. None by default.

  • cutoff (Optional[float]) – The cutoff decimal to be passed into difflib.get_close_matches(). 0.4 by default.

Returns

The list of choices for the autocomplete. Will return a maximum of 24 choices.

Return type

List[discord.app_commands.Choice]

Miscellaneous¶

merge_permissions¶

methods.merge_permissions(permissions, **perms)¶

Merges the passed permissions into a permission overwrite.

Note

This merge of permissions is done in place, meaning the overwrite object passed in will be merged. This means that this method does not return anything.

Parameters

  • overwrite (discord.PermissionOverwrite) – The permission overwrite to merge the permissions into.

  • permissions (discord.Permissions) – The permissions to merge.

generate_transaction_id¶

methods.generate_transaction_id(user_id=None, length=36)¶

Generates a UUID for an error.

Parameters

  • guild_id (Optional[int]) – The ID of the guild for the transaction.

  • user_id (Optional[int]) – The ID of the user for the transaction.

  • length (int) – How long the UUID should be. Defaults to 36.

Returns

The UUID for the error.

Return type

str

oauth_url¶

methods.oauth_url(*, permissions=..., guild=..., integration_type=IntegrationType.guild, redirect_uri=..., scopes=..., disable_guild_select=False, state=...)¶

A helper function that returns the OAuth2 URL for inviting the bot into guilds.

This method is modified from the discord.utils.oauth_url() method in discord.py to include the integration_type parameter.

Parameters

  • client_id (Union[int, str]) – The client ID of the bot.

  • permissions (discord.Permissions) – The permissions the bot should have in the guild. Defaults to MISSING..

  • guild (discord.abc.Snowflake) – The guild to preselect in the authorization screen. Defaults to MISSING..

  • integration_type (Union[src.enums.IntegrationType, int]) – The type of integration for the bot. Defaults to src.enums.IntegrationType.guild.

  • redirect_uri (str) – The redirect URI for the bot. Defaults to MISSING.

  • scopes (Iterable[str]) – The scopes the bot should have. Defaults to MISSING.

  • disable_guild_select (bool) – Whether to disable the guild select. Defaults to False.

  • state (Union[str, discord.app_commands.locale_str]) – The state of the bot. Defaults to MISSING.

Returns

The OAuth2 URL for inviting the bot into guilds.

Return type

str

get_max_file_upload_limit¶

methods.get_max_file_upload_limit(*, interaction=None, guild=None)¶

This method returns the maximum file upload limit for a guild, if provided. If a guild isn’t provided, returns the default file upload limit for Discord (defined as DISCORD_FILE_SIZE_LIMIT).

You can find the current file upload limit for Discord at https://discord.com/developers/docs/reference#uploading-files.

Note

The guild parameter will take precedence over the ctx and interaction parameters. The ctx and interaction parameters are only used if guild is not provided.

Parameters

  • ctx (Optional[discord.ext.commands.Context]) – The context object related to the context of the guild. defaults to None.

  • interaction (Optional[discord.Interaction]) – The interaction object related to the context of the guild. defaults to None.

  • guild (Optional[discord.Guild]) – The guild to get the file upload limit for. defaults to None.
